page.title: 10Marchwood village magazine
page.content: The {Marchwood Village News} was introduced to get the people who had been in Marchwood a long time and the newcomers, together.The cover was designed by the Parish Clerk until a year ago.Now it is drawn by local people and at Christmas by children. The magazine is paid for by the Parish Council and the advertisements help. The first edition was published in 1982 and was just a sheet.The Parish Clerk had to duplicate 4000 sheets. The duplicating machine used to pack up after about 20 minutes so it took her 3 to 4 days.The Parish Council thought it was too much work so they agreed to have them printed.They are distributed to the houses free of charge and consist of advertisements,articles on local groups,children's birthdays and general local news.
